channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Prince Harry settles lawsuit against Rupert Murdoch's U.K. News Group
item.description: Prince Harry has settled his lawsuit against Rupert Murdoch's British News Group Newspapers for an apology and "substantial damages."

item.title: Prince Harry settles with Murdoch's British tabloids as trial is about to begin
item.description: Prince Harry has agreed to settle his lawsuit against Rupert Murdoch's British tabloids. The deal ends a years' long battle to hold the newspapers acc...

item.title: Stay off the Charles River ice, even in the bitter cold. Here's why.
item.description: People have been trying to walk across the icy Charles River in Boston. Massachusetts State Police say it's just not safe.

item.title: Children among dead as Turkey hotel fire investigation continues
item.description: At least 76 people are known to have died, including children and multiple family members.

item.title: Harvard agrees to adopt a broad definition of antisemitism to settle two lawsuits
item.description: Several other schools have recently settled similar lawsuits, and suits are pending against others, including the University of Pennsylvania and Colum...

item.title: Ukraine says Russia hunts civilians with attack drones in the front-line city Kherson
item.description: Ukrainian officials say Russia is using drones to target civilians in Kherson. Some Russian soldiers appear to be bragging about the deadly attacks on...

item.title: US adults want border security action but mostly oppose arrests in schools, churches: AP-NORC poll
Fire risk and strong winds continue in Southern California with potential rain on the horizon
What Trump has done since taking power
item.description: The Republican has started his second term at a fast pace. Here's a handy guide to waht he's done so far.

item.title: India court orders seizure of 'offensive' MF Husain paintings
item.description: A complaint claimed that paintings of two Hindu deities at an art gallery "hurt religious sentiments".

item.title: Patriots safety Jabrill Peppers' trial expected to start today
item.description: New England Patriots safety Jabrill Peppers is scheduled to go on trial Wednesday in Quincy, Massachusetts on domestic violence charges.

item.title: What to know about protecting your cat from bird flu
item.description: A few cats have died from bird flu after eating raw food. And some raw pet food products have been recalled. Here's what to know about the risks to yo...

item.title: Cat mistakenly left on a plane, takes 3 trips covering 4,500 miles
item.description: A Maine coon cat named Mittens made three trips in 24 hours between New Zealand and Australia.

item.title: 2,000-year-old statue found dumped near garbage cans
item.description: Experts say the headless statue is from the Hellenistic period (between 323 and 31 BC), according to police.

item.title: Fire risk and strong winds continue in Southern California with rain on the horizon
item.description: Southern California was forecast to face more dangerous winds on Wednesday, but could get some badly needed rain this weekend, which could create new ...

item.title: Winter storm that dropped record-breaking snow in New Orleans spreads into Florida and the Carolinas
item.description: A major winter storm that slammed Texas and the northern Gulf Coast is spreading heavy snow, sleet and freezing rain across parts of the Florida panha...

item.title: Election of taoiseach delayed as dáil suspended amid disorder
item.description: A row broke out in the dáil, forcing the suspension of proceedings as the Irish parliament returned to nominate a new taoiseach.

item.title: What led to hotel fire disaster at Turkish ski resort?
item.description: Some survivors did not hear a fire alarm and there are claims of failures in the hotel's fire safety.
